recipe.name: Quick Chicken Pot Pie
recipe.description: This is how you make a pie from scratch in 20 minutes!
recipeIngredient: 1  sheet puff pastry ((25cm x 25cm / 10" x 10"), thawed)
400 g/13oz  chicken thigh fillets ((or tenderloin or breast), cut into small bite size pieces)
1  onion ((small, brown, white or yellow), diced)
1/4 cup marsala ((or dry sherry, port or white wine) (see notes))
2 cups frozen mixed peas (, corn and carrots, thawed)
2 cups milk ((full cream or low fat))
1/2 cup grated cheese ((any cheese that melts. I used tasty))

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 200C/390F. Lightly spray baking tray with oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 200C/390F. Lightly spray baking tray with oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut puff pastry into 4 pieces and place on baking tray. Bake for 15 minutes until puffed and golden. Remove from oven and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut puff pastry into 4 pieces and place on baking tray. Bake for 15 minutes until puffed and golden. Remove from oven and set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Meanwhile, melt butter in large pan over high heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile, melt butter in large pan over high heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Add onion and garlic cloves and sauté for 1 minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Add onion and garlic cloves and sauté for 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add bacon and chicken and cook for 2 to 3 minutes until chicken is lightly browned but still not cooked through inside.
recipeInstructions.name: Add bacon and chicken and cook for 2 to 3 minutes until chicken is lightly browned but still not cooked through inside.

recipeInstructions.text: Add marsala and cook for 30 seconds to allow the alcohol to cook out. Most of the marsala should evaporate.
recipeInstructions.name: Add marsala and cook for 30 seconds to allow the alcohol to cook out. Most of the marsala should evaporate.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the broccoli, peas, corn and carrots and stir to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the broccoli, peas, corn and carrots and stir to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle the flour over and add milk, stirring to dissolve the flour into the milk.
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle the flour over and add milk, stirring to dissolve the flour into the milk.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring to simmer then stir through cheese, salt and pepper. Adjust salt to your taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring to simmer then stir through cheese, salt and pepper. Adjust salt to your taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Simmer, stirring for 30 seconds to 1 minute until the sauce is thickened, then remove from heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Simmer, stirring for 30 seconds to 1 minute until the sauce is thickened, then remove from heat.

recipeInstructions.text: To serve, divide the chicken filling between 4 plates and top with a piece of puff pastry.
recipeInstructions.name: To serve, divide the chicken filling between 4 plates and top with a piece of puff pastry.

review.reviewBody: Great, quick weeknight recipe.  I ended up cooking each step a little longer but it was still fast and we received.
Thanks Nagi for another wonderful recipe. I added dried tarragon because I felt like it and it was relish.  I'm really enjoying your meals.

I had to sub kind of a lot but gee whiz is this AWESOME! I taste tested it after the filling was cooked and it's taking everything I have not to stand there and eat my whole pot. 

I has leftover fried chicken breasts and real bacon bits, then I forgot to buy broccoli and my mixed veggies had green beans. I diced the chicken, minutes the fried skins, and followed all the steps as directed. Yummy! This will be in my "rotation". Thank you for an amazing recipe!
Just made this pie for tonight’s dinner. Just WOW. This will be my go to recipe from now on. I also like that it doesn’t have cream as I don’t always have it on hand.
What a delicious recipe! I’ve made tried plenty chick pie versions and was by far the best. Thank you it will be a regular for us xx

Amazing! I used a blanco that I had in the fridge instead of marsala and it worked too. Didn’t add any extra sugar as I thought the wine was sweet enough!  I doubled the recipe but it was so good, it was only enough for 4 meals ;)

Very delicious, my husband and I loved it. I turned it into a bunch of individual pies for something different any they came out great! I have tried a lot of chicken pot pie recipes but this one by far is the best!
This was a cracker! Yummmm. Great out-of-the-box idea with the pastry!

Trying this lil' beauty 2nite! Great idea on the pastry!!

Also, there is a line above which says: "it’s thick and sweet and has a great death of flavour".

Ha!! I think it should read "depth" of flavour.......
